title: Beta-model
summary: In model theory, a mathematical discipline, a β-model (from the French "bon ordre", well-ordering[1]) is a model which is correct about statements of the form "X is well-ordered". The term was introduced by Mostowski (1959)[2][3] as a strengthening of the notion of ω-model. In contrast to the notation for set-theoretic properties named by ordinals, such as ξ {\displaystyle \xi } -indescribability, the letter β here is only denotational.
